name: Hustle Cat
description: You are Avery Grey, the newest employee at a popular cat cafe called A Cat's Paw. The coffee's good and the staff is friendly (and kinda cute!) but mysterious. One day, you find a strange book in the basement, with letters you can't quite read...
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: 2+ Ghz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Intel 3000HD or greater Sound Card: Optional, but recommended

reviews.review_text: Pros: + LGBT+ friendly + Pronoun selection + 10 to 20 hours of gameplay total + Beautiful Artwork + Meaningful decisions + Good story + Amazing soundtrack + Multiple endings  Cons: - Several typos (I only found 2) - Can be a bit cheesy at times  Opinions: ~ Characters are very cute ~ Hilarious dialogue ~ In-game architecture is astounding ~ Small but loving fanbase ~ Some of the characters are a bit stereotypical ~ (But I love them anyway) ~ Replaying the game for each route is somewhat tiresome  Definitely worth the price!

'Hustle Cat' is a true gem among visual novels, that are currently available on Steam. I absolutely adore this game. That being said, if you are interested in buying it, there are two things you need to consider. First of all, it's short. When you look at my playtime (add 1 or 2 hours for offline), you should know, that it took me that little to finish the WHOLE game (all six routes). Another thing is that decisions have very slight impact on the game, they are pretty much limited to choosing the character you will end up with. And while each route presents new scenes with your 'chosen one', the overall storyline remains the same, no matter who will you pick. I write about it here, because even though, usually, I considered things like that a flaw, that didn't bother me at all with this game.    Great things:

Disclosure: A couple of the development staff are friends of a friend of mine and she has been hounding me to check out Hustle Cat for literal months, even though she knows I'm not terribly fond of dating sims. In the time between her telling me about the game and me actually buying it, the evolution of my reaction to Hustle Cat kind of went like this: skeptical → willing to humor a good friend → confused by how intrigued I actually got → pleasantly surprised → oh no I'm crying → MY LIFE HAS BEEN RUINED  The one negative of this game I encountered was that there are still some bugs that need to be ironed out; the Steam overlay doesn't work and the game crashed on me three times. However, the game autosaves at basically every decision menu and scene change, so crashes don't set the player back too much.  If you enjoy cats, likeable characters, an interesting plot, great dialogue, cats, lovely art, great UX design, the ability to play a nonbinary protagonist, and cats, this is the game for you.  11/10 would battle rust with trash again

My goodness I really loved this game! Cats, pretty boys and girls, and magic! What could be better? I loved how custimizable this game was from pronouns to apearence! Avry's inner dialog was also funny and the writing was so charming. I love it!!!
Oh my gosh, this game is too cute^^

(A briefer summary of it all will be at the bottom, in case you don't wanna go through a full essay!)   Hustle Cat doesn't really have what you'd call a proper  gameplay  exactly, though you could say the same about several other members of the Visual Novel genre, and I can name several that still don't give you as many options and interaction as Hustle Cat does, even if the ones it gives are a little bit light. It's definitely not for you if you're not a fan of text-heavy games, but you'll be right at home if you're into that stuff, or if you're looking to start!  With that in mind, Hustle Cat happens to have a WONDERFUL set of characters, a pretty engaging plot, and overall just really, really nice writing! The way characters are written and their dialogue is laid out is done in a way that you really don't see very often in several games, and though I absolutely liked some more than others, there truly weren't any characters I disliked at all. Avery, the protagonist, is an easy example of splendid characterization, and their interactions with the cafe's staff are really fun to read and enjoyable to go through.  I will say there were a couple of routes were things were handled a little bit strangely, and some certainly feel like they received less attention than others, although that tends to be mostly in the pictures department rather than in writing. General favoritism is there, but this isn't to say that the ones that were noticeably better liked by Date Nighto weren't amazing to play through!  It's easy to catch wind of how to go through each route, and though runs past your first might be a little bit uneventful on your way to taking on another one, the fact you can speed up doesn't really let that drag for too long.   I do wish that the whole 'cat' aspect of the game, which is the lead appeal, hadn't been dropped the way it was, though, but that might just be me. I'll give them a TON of praise for using the word 'witch' as unisex, though! You hardly see people realizing it's unisex in most games these days!    Moving on to the music, I can say it was...all right! Nothing really stood out to me, and most of the songs began as generic before shifting to repetitive, but I wouldn't say they ever got grating or annoying to listen to, and some were very much perfect for the mood, at times. ...Big emphasis on 'at times', though, as there were tons of moments through the game where I felt as though a change in song or maybe a bit of silence would've been much better suited (almost expected) for what the text was carrying the mood through. It definitely took away from some scenes, for me.  Next, we have the art! And boy, Hustle Cat is PRETTY! The character expressions might be a little awkward rarely, but I usually found them to be really nice and fun to look at! The mugshot models themselves are really nicely shaded, with thick lines and great color choices that keep everything vibrant, cute, and just really...alive! Each character gets a very nice and decent selection of expressions as well, which keeps the text accompanying them always engaging!  If there's anything to complain about, it'd be that certain of the special event pictures tend to have awkward faces or anatomy at times, and then you have some others that just don't have shading at all, which I found really strange. These aren't so many that it'd damage the overall quality, though.  The interface is kind of generic for what you'd expect of a visual novel, and can be a little plain here and there, but it's definitely not unfitting or clashing with the style. It's cute, simple, and not pretentious or intrusive, so I can't complain at all.  One thing I absolutely wanna praise is the game's auto save feature! While it's not good advertising to say that the game crashed on me twice, it did happen at times when I was speeding through the dialogue, and my laptop happened to also be running several other things at the time. But, thanks to the auto saving, I really didn't need to worry, since I could just hop back onto where I was just playing last time!   Overall!

It is an otome, if you like otomes you will probably like this one. If you do not, then it is likely not a game meant for you. It is a more PG otome, so do not expect explicit.  I have played all the routes (and got the achievements) and I find it was a great decision to have you play through all of the others before getting to Graves, who gives you a larger explanation as to what is going on. The art is cute, the characters are likeable, and act III has some good intensity to it. If you like the story and characters, it has replay value.  My only criticisms are I wish it had been a little longer to dedicate to the relationship building. As it is, it is fine, but it is not the longest game. I also wish there was some voice acting, as I feel it gives more life to the characters, but I also understand that means more time, more employees, and more money involved. My last is the antagonists’ motivation (which I will not spoil here). I feel it could have been something more substantial.  Either way, it is a fun cute story with good characters. As I said, if you like PG otomes with a bit of a weird flair to them, you will like this.

Just play it. If you like to have a good more realistic and natural interaction between the characters and their development just play this game. Is adorable, all the characters are memorable and their stories are all engaging and fun. And don't stop on one only. Get the 100%. It's totally worth it.  Congratulations to the developers.

This was so sweet, and definitely one of my favourite otome games yet! You can tell it was made with a lot of love. All of the routes were great but I especially adored Hayes and Mason.  Cats, coffee and magic. <3 I wouldn't change a thing.  I also loved that you can choose the MCs pronouns, skin colour and between a feminine or masculine appearance.

Pro's - Great Music - Great story - Each character play through is diffent. - There is achivements for each ended so its great for the completionist out there. - It is good for teh exerpence visual novel gamers and newbies.  The only con I can think of is they could of added voice acting to make it even greater of a game but thats just peronal refernce.

I'e been waiting for the game to come out so i was very excited by the release for it. I really loved the story so far its a bit simple but its done really well. I was pretty sucked into it my first playthrough. The characters are well rounded and have their own personalities. I really like the artwork in the game and the music is enjoyable through out. If i had any complaints I feel some of the endings and relationships were a little rushed, but it didn't really bother me though. Its a cute little game and it just makes me happy after playing it.
The best dating sim i've every played, and i've played a John Cena dating sim.
This game is the best.

I enjoyed this game a lot!! Like honestly I've never liked a dating sim this much The characters are adorable, the music and art is great, and the plot is fun with just enough potential danger to keep things interesting. The option to change your pronouns through the course of the game is super cool!  Will be playing all the routes.
An adorable game that I often come back to. LGBTQIA friendly choices and options, a nice variety of characters, and an interesting story.
A nice little visual novel, I enjoyed it and highly recoomend it
I fell in love with gay cats.
Your normal dating sim where everyone's a secret cat, with a twist. Touch all the butts to unlock the secret butt. 10/10
I love this game it's so cute. One of the best games I've played this year.

I found Hustle Cat an interesting story, and I played through the game in the entirety of it's offering as soon as I bought it. I wouldn't call it a hard or particularly long game, but it has some great moments and truly loveable charachters, wether it's the mother hen esque Landry, the shy yet sweet Hayes, or the silent yet powerful and protective Mason I found myself enthralled in the characters. I did find some characters more interesting than others, and some endings left me feeling truly happy. That being said the final ending left me still wondering what had gone down between the antagonist and Graves, and that route was also kind of meh worthy overall in my opinion, it was nice seeing more of Graves and getting some better answers about what was going on, but overal I was still left wanting. I can't help but wonder if the game had gotten more money when it was on kickstarter it would feel more complete to me. Perhaps, perhaps not, but either way what is here is overall satisfying even if it leaves me wanting more time with these characters.

It is so cute! I wish it wasn't so repetetive. (And its pretty short...) I wish each character had a little bit of diversity like Grave's did, besides knowing their story. But still a fantastic game and I love it so so much!!!!
The routes are a little repetative after you've done one already, but it's a really enjoyable game, I'd definitely recommend.
a little short, but i hope they change that, in future updates. LOVE this game!

Found this game via. Tumblr from a friend and I'm so glad I got this game. I enjoy the music as well as the art. Fell in love with Finley and Mason right away <3 I wish there was more to the game like other villians or maybe side quests because once you go a certain route, you kind of don't see much of the other characters. Or maybe even a sequel when Avery gets older and then becomes the next owner of the cafe for real? :0
Super cute, funny, and replayable.

I've never really been a fan of dating sim games, but I have to say that Hustle Cat has gotten me intrested in the genre. The characters are charming and the storylines are short and sweet. The begining does get a little repetitave when you go for the other routes but that's just the genre for you I guess. Also the main character is relatable to a pretty decent degree to the point where I could get behind one decision or another. There are a few minor bugs, but nothing that takes away from the overall charm. Nonethless, Hustle Cat is a very charming game with an intresting story and worth at least a few playthroughs.

This game was very cute. Every character was unique and lovable in their own way. And the writing and art are both really charming. I came into this game blind and with standard expectations but it definitely went above and beyond. I definitely would recommend this game if you want to just sit down and read a fun and cute little adventure (especially if you like cats)
I LOVED IT graves route was the best

Absolutely wonderful story! I love how the game adds small details to the lore each time you take a different path. I certainly left each path feeling dreadful that the story ended so quickly; it will leave you wanting more and more.  I hope to see a sequel or at least another game by the same developing team soon! Maybe with some wickedly cool animated scenes? That would be the icing on the cake!

I havent exactly finished the game yet, but I'd say it's worth the price! You kind of warm up to everybody, even if you don't find them appealing at first. That's how these game always kind of go for me personally though!  Also I'm fairly certain Hayes' full name is 'Hayes, of all people' because that's what avery has to say every time he does  anything . 'The first person to do x was Hayes, of all people' 'Hayes of all people was the one who x' Avery you don't have to be surprised that it's not impossible for him to act on his own. 10/10 I think
Great game. Some of the endings were a bit odd but the art is lovely. I played through all the routes and loved the majority of them. A lot of love and character were put into this game.
LGBT friendly! i love finley so much, but i will definitely play through all routes! awesome story!!

Adorable game! Each plot line and character has its own special something to love. I also like that the main character can be male, female, or gender neutral, and that you can change gender in-game as you see fit. Great game, and I'd love to see more by this writer!

This was a very enjoyable game for me. Funny dialouge and great characters, albeit a tad predictable but I'm not complaining. The illustrations are nice and I love the fact that the mc is customizable ad you get to choose pronouns, skin colour and how you want to present yourself( masculine/feminine)! The only complaint I have is the fact that the gallaery is missing two illustrations even though I finished the whole game. When viewing illustrations including Avery you can choose between all of their different presentations which is nice but the banner covers a lot of the image so a big chunk actually gets cut out, unless you can disable the banner though which I'm not aware of. It's a shame since the art is so splendid.  Over all though this was a great experience for me and I'd love to see more games like this in the future.   Highly Recommend.

I love cats. This game is about a cat cafe. I bought it because of Dodger's LP. Best Man is Graves. Best Woman is Mason. The only route I didn't enjoy was Finley's, because it was very stupid and overexagerated. Other than that, this game is enjoyable. A bit pricey for the length, but still worth it.

Very cute and exciting game :) Very good writing, a little mysterious and short though.  I really liked the fact that you could change your appearance and pronouns, all in all: Definitely play if you like cats and dating games!

Watched many people play Hustle Cat, and bought it for the everything. What's not to like? -Cute cats? Check -Wonderful soundtrack? Check -Cute humans? CHECK WONDERFUL CATS ARE BEST CATS YES BUY GAME TIS BE CUTE AF. Thank you.

I love this game a lot, everyone was really cute!!   Good stuff:  - Adorable characters (My fave goes Graves>Reese>Mason>Hayes>Landry>Finley) Avery her/him/themself is very charming and cute!  - Good writing -- I was captivated by what was going on and it was hard to pull myself away from the game! I enjoyed every bit of it!!  - Incredible art -- It's very pretty, the only issue I had was that all the ending CGs were only views of the character's backs...? It would have been nice to see more variety in poses for the ending CGs... But otherwise I'm not complaining since we get to kiss everyone heh   Could be improved:  - Skipping. I was initially confused by the skipping feature because... It's slow. I thought maybe it was an 'auto' button instead but it felt a bit too fast to be that either. The skipping feature also made it hard to tell when you encounter new/unread text because it's only a tad slower than the skipping speed. It would be nice if the skipping is faster and skips over sprite transitions, but stops immediately upon encountering new text. Just my advice?  - Personal opinion but I felt the romance feels a bit rushed. Then again I don't think Avery has spent enogh time at the cafe within the game to develop the romance more? Or it could be because after skipping through most of the common route I slowly stopped feeling as much for the characters... --  I finished the game in about 9 hours apparently? And that's including (long) toilet breaks. Honestly speaking I wouldn't have paid $20 but now that it's on sale it's definitely worth grabbing!! Overall still a pleasant experience! :)  Personal play order was Mason, Finley, Hayes, Landry, Reese, Graves. I suggest leaving Reese for last to unlock Graves. But there's no specific play order either which is great!! Enjoy the game :>

+ dialogue that's actually FUNNY and really witty sometimes + good writing; not overly descriptive, but engaging and funny + MC is relatable and brave (never pathetic, though a little slobbish) + every character is likable (after playing their route at least) + short routes (1-2 hrs ea.), one ending per character (6 total) + easy achievements + Cats. CATS EVERYWHERE. <3  Honestly I didn't expect this VN to turn out to be one of my favorites. The writing and dialogue really wins me over - Hustle Cat doesn't pad out the story with excessive dialogue and description. It's not tiresome to read, and there's no stupid or angsty drama to endure. It's a nice and sweet story, with a good MC and great characters. Highly recommended.  PS. Get all the routes for Graves. He turned out to be my fave route. <3
